TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Beale, you're goddamn GENIUS.

Man, FOBO is FREAKING PERFECT for an aeroshell designs!

Uses ProcFairings and Oblivion Aerospace 2.5m conical heatshield.

Here is the Bop-Pol grunt in all of its glory!

http://i.imgur.com/gqTVa4v.png

The lower section is the orbiter that will orbit both Bop and Pol (it should have enough dv), while the lander will land on Bop or Pol, i haven't decided yet (which one do you guys think is more intersting? Bop or Pol?)

Unfortuately i will have to wait a bit to launch it beacuse the Jool window is still far...

what mod is that orbiter tank/engine from? I know it's a fregat, but where?

what mod is that orbiter tank/engine from? I know it's a fregat, but where?

It's from this pack: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/94477-0-24-2-Albert-Kermin-Industries-Stock-alike-Random-Rocket-Parts-(v0-12) but i removed the stock strut

BTW, Beale: I suggest that you don't name it Agena - to avoid any possible confusions with real Agena. FOBO is a pretty cool name - I think you should leave it.
Or maybe Hadar?

The lower section is the orbiter that will orbit both Bop and Pol (it should have enough dv), while the lander will land on Bop or Pol, i haven't decided yet (which one do you guys think is more intersting? Bop or Pol?)

Unfortuately i will have to wait a bit to launch it beacuse the Jool window is still far...

I'd say Pol!

Or maybe Hadar?

I've changed it to Carina

Fobo test

Nice work

I've changed it to Carina

I'd vote down this but only because I once had a crush on a girl named Karina.

Just joking, everything is awesome!

I've started "Iskhod" (it means "Exodus" in English, if i remember correctly) project, with it's goal to make one way to Laythe Trip. Secret launches of Proton and N-1 at night delivered parts for an unprecedented habitat module housing... 51 Kerbals! Here is the construction process. Unfortunately, I have no idea how to make a compact propulsion system. BTW, who will guess what is hidden under the fairings on the top of the spaceship?

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Sweet!

Actually that triple-habitation bit made from the IXS (I think) parts is really good.

I am scratching my head a little over the secret payload, a little too small for anything manned, a probe of some kind..? Hmm.

*insert sarcastic voice*Nooooo! Baht I lieked it as FOBO. Plus none of the other cores are called anything special. Will the core still stay as FOBO? Because we could think of a great acronym. And by we, I mean everybody here on this thread.

The core is already called the "Probodobodyne FOBO", but that's the only bit.

There's already a naming convention of stars and constellations that I'm sticking to.

The core is already called the "Probodobodyne FOBO", but that's the only bit.

Hmm... I wonder what an achronym should be for the FOBO.
Where have you been all my life...

Actually that triple-habitation bit made from the IXS (I think) parts is really good.

I am scratching my head a little over the secret payload, a little too small for anything manned, a probe of some kind..? Hmm.

It's just three SXT's large aircraft fuselages on a 2.5-3.75 stock adapter.

And about that payload, you are right, it's a FOBO "beacon", which will mark the landing site.

A manned Fobos Grunt! How have I not thought of this?

Fobos/Cygnus lander Mk.II orbital test and no name SSTO

Edited October 5, 2014 by kopapaka

Beale, could you make an Instrument Unit for the Proton that could apply torque and provide electricity, perhaps also unmanned control for the 3rd stage (and the payload)? It'd be useful especially for those that like to launch their rockets using MechJeb. Here's my concept of how it'd be crafted:

You could split the 3rd stage into two pieces along that red line, the stage itself below it (and probably take out some fuel for that) and the IU above that line, so that it'd be a two-for-one deal.

Beale, could you make an Instrument Unit for the Proton that could apply torque and provide electricity, perhaps also unmanned control for the 3rd stage (and the payload)? It'd be useful especially for those that like to launch their rockets using MechJeb. Here's my concept of how it'd be crafted:

You could split the 3rd stage into two pieces along that red line, the stage itself below it (and probably take out some fuel for that) and the IU above that line, so that it'd be a two-for-one deal.

Hmm, I support that proposal. After all, Proton does have IU on its 3rd stage.

Although, such thing would be somewhat useless for MJ users without a patch that adds MJ to every probe core - you'll still need to strap AR202 case to it.

Hmm, I support that proposal. After all, Proton does have IU on its 3rd stage.

Although, such thing would be somewhat useless for MJ users without a patch that adds MJ to every probe core - you'll still need to strap AR202 case to it.

I do use that patch. And yeah, most would still have to put on the case. Then again, before I installed the patch, I almost always put the case on the payload and not the rocket itself, unless I wanted to save the rocket for later. Without the case, the IU would still be useful in that it'd provide the torque necessary to fine-tune the combined stage/payload's orientation in burns such as circularization, interplanetary transfers, deorbitings, etc, and also in providing electricity should the payload need to wait a few orbits before burning, if mission requirements call for power generators to be deployed after such burns are complete. :l
